Hosting and Updating

Hosting

Extensions must be uploaded through the Developer Dashboard and are distributed in the Chrome Web Store to protect users from malicious extensions. Allow users to add an extension from the web store without leaving developer's website by enabling inline installation.

There are three exceptions to the Chrome Web Store hosting rule:

  1. Extensions that comply with the enterprise policy.
  2. Linux specific extensions.
  3. Unpacked files from your local machine while in developer mode.

Read more about the hosting policy.

Updating

Extensions are automatically updated without user intervention, just like the Chrome Browser.

To update an extension, you will need to increase the version number in the manifest: 

{
  ...
  "version": "1.5",
  ...
  }
}
{
  ...
  "version": "1.6",
  ...
  }
}

Then re-package it. Locate the extension in the Developer Dashboard and click Edit. After you have uploaded the new version and clicked Publish the update will automatically be pushed out to users over the next few hours.
